remarks: The norm on a subspace is a restriction of the norm on the parent space.  (Contributed by NM, 28-Jan-2008.) (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:
sspn.y $e |- Y = ( BaseSet ` W ) $.
sspn.n $e |- N = ( normCV ` U ) $.
sspn.m $e |- M = ( normCV ` W ) $.
sspn.h $e |- H = ( SubSp ` U ) $.
sspn $p |- ( ( U e. NrmCVec /\ W e. H ) -> M = ( N |` Y ) ) $.
